member.name: T:Commandos.Commands.BasicCommands
member.summary: Commands for everyday usage. Very common and useful.

member.name: M:Commandos.Commands.BasicCommands.Help(System.String)
member.summary: Without a parameter lists all commands. With a parameter lists description of the command provided from the XML description of the method.

member.name: M:Commandos.Commands.BasicCommands.Quit
member.summary: Quits

member.name: M:Commandos.Commands.BasicCommands.Echo(System.String[])
member.summary: Repeats given string arguments. Each argument will be in a new line. To write a string with spaces use "". If the first argument is a valid integer number, the arguments after will be repeated that many times.

member.name: M:Commandos.Commands.BasicCommands.Add(System.Single[])
member.summary: Adds together all numbers provided. They can be integer or float, positive or negative. Use commas for float numbers.

member.name: M:Commandos.Commands.BasicCommands.ListDir(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Lists all subdirectories of provided root directory.
member.param: Absolute path of root to list from.
Whether to list only top layer or go into nested directories.
Maximum depth of nested directories to search in. Set to -1 for infinite. Only used if deep is true.
Current depth of recursion in searching nested directories.

member.name: M:Commandos.Commands.BasicCommands.Clear
member.summary: Clears the console.

member.name: M:Commandos.Commands.BasicCommands.Wait(System.Single)
member.summary: Waits for x seconds.

member.name: T:Commandos.Commands.ImageCommands
member.summary: Bunch of image display functions.

member.name: M:Commandos.Commands.ImageCommands.ShowImage(System.String)
member.summary: Draws an image to the console.
member.param: Absolute path to the png or jpg file.

member.name: M:Commandos.Commands.ImageCommands.PlayVideo(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Plays a video in the console using shit I don't understand quite well. It's a lot of operations with bytes and pointers to make it faster (~12 FPS). I highly recommend downscaling videos to 12 FPS and letting it play at original FPS. WARNING: This command can be used only ONCE in a single application run due to internal architecture of consoles. It does some weirdy stuff with the way console renders text, and you can't reenter the state again.
member.param: Absolute path to the video file.

FPS you wish the video to play at. Set to -1 for automatic FPS recognition (original from the file). Disclaimer: This changes how many frames are attempted to be rendered per second, not how many actually are. Make it bigger than original FPS, speed up video. Make it smaller than original FPS, slow down video. The console can't achieve rendering speeds above 12 FPS.

member.name: T:Commandos.Commands.ProgrammingCommands
member.summary: Commands for programming. Cool ik.

member.name: M:Commandos.Commands.ProgrammingCommands.SaveSequence(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Saves the provided sequence as the provided name.
member.param: Sequence to save. First argument (word) is ommited. Such as: save help seq(ommited) help.

member.name: M:Commandos.Commands.ProgrammingCommands.ListSequences
member.summary: Lists all saves sequences and their names.

member.name: M:Commandos.Commands.ProgrammingCommands.ExecuteSequence(System.String)
member.summary: Executes saved sequence by given sequence name.
member.param: Name of saved sequence to execute.

member.name: M:Commandos.Commands.ProgrammingCommands.SequenceOfCommands(System.String[])
member.summary: Creates and runs a new sequence using given commands. Separate commands with ; such as: seq help; wait 3; q
member.param: Commands to execute in this sequence.

member.name: M:Commandos.Commands.ProgrammingCommands.ArgumentCommand(System.String[])
member.summary: Inputs value(s) that are returned by command(s) into the first command. First argument is command to put values into, next are commands to get values from. Separate commands with ; just like in sequences.
member.param: First is command to input values to, second and next are command(s) to get values from.

member.name: T:Commandos.Commands.Settings
member.summary: Commands that change the behavior of the console.

member.name: F:Commandos.Commands.Settings.ConsoleColors
member.summary: Colors for the console.

member.name: M:Commandos.Commands.Settings.SettingsCommand(System.String[])
member.summary: Sets multiple settings of the console to the desired value. Use: color [target] [color] to change the color of the target (info/user/system/warn/error/background) to a valid ConsoleColor. (red/darkred/blue...)
member.param: First is the setting to change, next are parameters unique to that setting.
